acid was bottle tipped over in sand prior to sample plunging in (bottle was empty). wiped outside and then plunged sample. 4th turbidity taken
HQ40d-2 having connection issues; battery a little over half
4 dogs in and out of water close to samplers; very low tide- King Tide yesterday; calm, no waves; Re-read DO % (1st read was 80.0%); King Tide June 14-15
Photo of low tide (Meredith); Turbidity meter wouldn't turn on - adjusted batteries and it worked; Low DO 2nd read = 77.5%; King Tide June 14-15
Sample is QA'd out due to sampling in too shallow of water
4 people in the water initiallt but 2 exited to the beach before sample was taken; 4th Turbidity = 1.39; Confirmed Salinity with 2nd read; King Tide June 14-15
4th Turbidity read = 1.77; 5th Turbidity read = 2.52 (replaced 3rd read which was 3.00); 2nd consistent read for Salinity (35.5) and DO% (113.7); King Tide June 14-15
Calm, sunny, clear skies, canoe setting up to go out as sample was taken; Photo taken of freshwater (Kristie), resembles last session; took a 4th turbidity reading

Canoe just paddled past sample sit minutes before sample taken and stirred up sand & sediments; Most of the shore looks murky; Took a 4th turbidity reading; 2nd D0 reading = 4.65 mg/L and 70.7% (temp & salinity consistent)
4 kayaks floated by before sample; Less murky than PLHl Very shallow; 4th & 5th turbidty taken
Calm, sunny, more clear than last 2 sites; 4th turbidity reading

small shore break; strong drop off & undertow; At lab: Post-sampl Blank 1st read = 0.58 NTU (clean & oiled); 2nd read= 0.34 NTU (repeat); 3rd = 0.76... replaced blank with spare cell for the field tomorrow

Beach-goer/ local said sediment cleared up through channel after last swell. Site seemed clearer. Canoe paddled through site ~5 min before sample was taken. SUP Yoga class with 4 people ~30 ft from sample site. Calm waters. Monk seal resting ~200 feet out.
No samples taken because of traffic preventing access to site.
No samples taken because of traffic preventing access to site.

2 SUPs walking out in water just prior to sampling. Filter gets more difficult 1/2 way through.

Turbidity Low pre-sample readings: 5.61 and 5.63 NTU. 5 turbidity readings. Forgot to invert for first reading.

Sites overall: not much wave or water action; several sites seem more turbid; wave patterns causing lingering turbidity.
2 dogs in the water

New paddle, double hull boat causing minimal parking.
Fire in Kaua'ula Valley started 11/8/22. 850+ acres burned so far and not yet fully controlled. (People in water included 5 kayaks or 20 people)
Shallow, calm water and sediment very visible; silty; 4th turbidity reading = 24.6. (Photo of water flow at entrance)
